Title: Less Carbon Footprint in Edge Computing by Joint Task Offloading and Energy Sharing
Abstract: we address reducing carbon footprint  cf  in the context of edge computing. the carbon intensity of electricity supply largely varies spatially as well as temporally. we consider optimal task scheduling and offloading as well as battery charging to minimize the total cf. we formulate this optimization problem as a mixed integer linear programming model. however we demonstrate that via a graph based reformulation the problem can be cast as a minimum cost flow problem and global optimum can be admitted in polynomial time. numerical results using real world data show that optimization can reduce up to 83.3% of the total cf.
